results.title: Machine gun blues = Black rose of Harlem
results.creator_credit: Pacific Trust, Mike Elliott, Roger Corman and Fred Gallo
results.brief_description: Set in Harlem in 1931 during the era of depression, bootlegging, mobsters and smokey nightclubs where white patrons came to see black jazz singers. Also a time when the mafia were trying to move in on the nightclubs and assert their control over the black Americans, a time of violence and machine guns and death to those who dared to challenge “the boss”. Georgia Freeman (Cynda Williams), a black jazz singer and Johnny Verona (Nick Cassavetes) a white mobster who works for Costanza (Joe Viterelli), “the boss”, find themselves entangled in a fiery and passionate affair which eventually can only lead to disaster, especially when Johnny is already betrothed to Costanza’s daughter. When Costanza decides to take over the nightclub where Georgia sings, all hell breaks loose. Racial tension, dangerous liaisons, lots of action and a great jazz soundtrack with a cast including Lawrence Monoson, Richard Brooks, Garrett Morris, Richard T. Jones, Tony Burton and Maria Ford. Music produced by Paul di Franco.

results.title: Macedonia
results.creator_credit: General Secretariat of Press and Information of Greece and Giorgos Zervoulakos
results.brief_description: A history of Greek Macedonia from prehistoric times to the 19th Century. It covers the relationship between Macedonia and early Greece, the life of the greatest of all Macedonians, Alexander the Great, the Ottoman invasion and longterm occupation by the Turks and the 19th Century resistance to the invaders. It also retells the Greek myths and sources of contemporary folk dances in Macedonia.

results.title: Macbeth: the politics of power
results.brief_description: An interpretation of characters. Are the witches goddesses of fate, wicked old hags, or figments of Macbeth’s imagination? How does Macbeth remain a tragic hero when he is portrayed as a brutal murderer? Is Duncan a wise monarch, or an arrogant, corrupt and senile old man? What is the relationship among the main characters?

results.title: Macbeth: an opera in four acts
results.creator_credit: Southern Television, Humphrey Burton and Dave Heather
results.brief_description: Macbeth, an opera in four acts after William Shakespeare, libretto by Francesco Maria Piave and Andrea Maffei and music by Giuseppe Verdi, performed live at Glyndebourne in 1972 by the Glyndebourne Ballet and Festival Chorus with the London Philharmonic Orchestra conducted by John Pritchard. This production features international singer Kostas Paskalis in the lead role of Macbeth with Josephine Barstow as Lady Macbeth, James Morris (Banquo), Keith Erwen (Macduff), Ian Caley (Malcolm), Rae Woodland (Gentlewoman), Brian Donlan (the Doctor), and John Tomlinson (the murderer). Recorded for television as part of the Glyndebourne Festival series. Sung in Italian with occasional English subtitles and includes a guide in English.

results.title: Macbeth: a performance of Macbeth by William Shakespeare
results.creator_credit: Royal Shakespeare Company, Thames Television, Trevor Nunn and Phillip Casson
results.brief_description: Ian McKellen and Judi Dench star as Lord and Lady Macbeth in what is considered to be one of the best productions of Macbeth. McKellen won the 1976 Plays and Players Best Actor award and Judi Dench the 1977 Society of West End Theatres’ Best Actress award for their roles. A small group of actors create the play for a small audience in an intimate atmosphere. Intense and compelling, the production uses the costumes and props of the Royal Shakespeare Company.

results.title: Macbeth by William Shakespeare: an introduction
results.creator_credit: Film Associates, BHE Education, Insight Productions (US) and Raoul Sobel
results.brief_description: An abbreviated version of Macbeth is performed by a talented English company. Brief narrative bridges are used to connect the scenes, forming a comprehensible and dramatic introduction to the play. The adaption preserves the sense of madness and tragedy of the full length drama.

results.title: Macbeth [Animated]
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, Christopher Grace, Elizabeth Babakhina, Natalia Orlova and et al
results.brief_description: With two US Emmy Awards, “Shakespeare - Animated tales” has won a vast new audience with its skilful, 30 minute adaptations. This can be used as a companion piece to the study of “Macbeth”, however it is far too succinct a precis to be a useful study piece for serious students of the Bard.
